item.title: Today’s Wordle #1539: Hints And Answer For September 5, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle is a game that challenges players to guess a new five-letter word every day in six turns or less. Whether you’re a seasoned player or just starting out, knowing today’s hints and strategies can help you solve Wordle faster and improve your daily streak. Of course, that’s if you don’t mind the extra assistance. If you’ve found yourself struggling with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful tips and even the answer for Wordle Game #1539 for September 5, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information will include spoilers on today’s, and yesterday’s, edition of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players get six attempts to guess the five-letter word answer. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

  • Hint 2: Today’s Wordle answer has just one vowel
  • Hint 3: One definition for Thursday’s answer is to “move aimlessly”
  • Hint 5: There are no repeating letters in today’s Wordle word, so make sure to focus on unique letters in your first guesses.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1539 for September 5, 2025

Starter Words For September 5, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer handed to you, there are a few starter words worth trying. A couple starter words that may help are:

  • DOORS

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1539 On September 5, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including looking at the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: DRIFT

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

item.title: Steam’s New VR Headset Might Have A Name
item.content:encoded:
It looks like there might be an official name for the Valve’s new Steam VR headset, currently known as “Deckard”.

According to a trademark filing, along with some data mining, Steam’s next VR headset will known as the “Steam Frame”. Per the trademark filing, the Steam Frame is “intended to cover the categories of computer hardware; computer networking hardware; computer peripherals; computer hardware and computer software for the reproduction, processing, and streaming of audio, video, data, text, and multimedia content.”

Along with the trademark filing, dataminer Lifeismana found various strings in the latest SteamVR update that specifically mention the “Steam Frame” device.

More Than Just A Device Name

In addition to the Steam Frame name, prominent Valve insider Brad Lynch had more details on what Valve’s plans are.

Lynch says that Valve is planning on rebranding SteamVR “overlays” to “Frames”. He added that the major selling point of the device is expected to be “spatial gaming”.

Insider Gaming has reached out to Valve for comment on the trademark filing and what’s been found in the files. Should a response be received, it will be added to this article.

item.title: Civilization 7 Developer Firaxis Holds Layoffs
item.content:encoded:
Civilization 7 developer Firaxis is holding layoffs. Multiple employees at the studio have taken to social media to announce that they were being let go from the company.

Those let go from the company include writer Emma Kidwell, producer Maya H, lead character artist Matthew Davis, and more.

“Hi! I was laid off from Firaxis this morning,” Kidwell said. “I wrote leaders and civs for Civilization VII (NDA for now) and Deadpool and Storm for Marvel’s Midnight Suns.”

Said Maya H, “”I was laid off this morning from Firaxis, which was my favorite job I’ve had.”

What Did 2K Say About The Firaxis Layoffs?

In a statement on the matter, 2K confirmed the layoffs at Firaxis were part of the a “restructure”.

“We can confirm there was a staff reduction today at Firaxis Games, as the studio restructures and optimizes its development process for adaptability, collaboration, and creativity,” the publisher said.

Insider Gaming reached out for more clarification on how many people were impacted by the layoffs. Should a response be received, this article will be updated accordingly.

Recently, Take-Two Interactive CEO Strauss Zelnick said that Civilization 7 “had challenges” with its launch, though he admitted that it’s something that seems to regularly happen with the series. Civilization 7 took a bold new step for the franchise, introducing a new Ages system for players, which has been divisive among players since the game’s February 2025 release.

item.title: Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft Final Season Releases in December
item.content:encoded:
Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft charts its final course with Season 2, coming to Netflix in December 2025.

The show takes place after the events of the Survivor Trilogy and follows Lara Croft on her journey to become the iconic Tomb Raider. Originally premiering last year in October, the animated series by Powerhouse Animation Studios, was renewed shortly after premiering. While the news that Season 2 is the final one is new, there’s a lot in store, including a new cast member.

Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft Ending With Season 2

In an exclusive article from Variety, it was announced that Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft will end with Season 2. It was also confirmed that the show will release on Netflix on December 11th, 2025. While no trailer is available, we do have an official logline, thanks to Variety.

“When adventurer Lara Croft (voiced by Hayley Atwell) discovers a trail of stolen African Orisha masks, she joins forces with her best friend Sam (Karen Fukuhara) to retrieve the precious artifacts. Lara’s thrilling new adventure takes her around the globe as she delves deeper into the hidden secrets of Orisha history, dodging the machinations of a dangerous and enigmatic billionaire who wants the masks for herself, while discovering these relics contain dark secrets and a power that defies logic. Power that may, in fact, be divine.”

Joining the star-studded cast, which includes MCU’s Hayley Atwell, is The Boys’ Karen Fukuhara. She will play the role of Sam, who returns from 2013’s Tomb Raider. Much like Camilla Luddington with Hayley, Karen replaces K-Pop: Demon Hunters’ Arden Cho, who portrayed Sam in the original.

The Tomb Raider news comes a day after Prime Video’s update on its live-action version. With Sophie Turner as Lara Croft, the show enters production in January 2026. As we don’t know what version Prime Video’s Lara Croft will be, Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft may be a good start.

Are you sad that The Legend of Lara Croft is ending? Did you watch the first season on Netflix? Let us know in the comments and on the forums!

item.title: Rematch Patch 3 With Crossplay Delayed On Day Of Launch
item.content:encoded:
Fans waiting for crossplay in Rematch will have to wait a bit longer. With Rematch patch 3 set to release on Thursday, September 4, developer Sloclap has announced that they had to delay its launch in order to investigate a new issue that appeared.

The third major patch for Rematch was originally planned for September 3 but was delayed to September 4 at the last minute to fix two bugs that were found during final testing. With the new date set, another major issue was found causing yet another delay.

When Will Rematch Patch 3 Be Released?

In a message on the game’s official Discord, Sloclap said that during final testing, “a significant number of testers were stuck in matchmaking, unable to cancel or restart the process” when crossplay was enabled in Rematch. This issue, they said, has led to the decision to delay the update again due to crossplay being “at the core of this update”.

“We know this is very disappointing news and we share your frustration,” Sloclap said. “Our recent track record with patch stability hasn’t been up to standards, and we don’t want to release a patch that will introduce new issues.”

They continued: “Our focus right now is on resolving this matchmaking issue as quickly as possible. At the same time, we’re actively working on improving our production pipeline so that future updates are delivered with the quality and reliability you deserve – and more importantly, we will refrain from announcing release dates until we are absolutely certain that we can deliver the updates on time.”

As of publishing, no new date has been set for Rematch Patch 3. When that is announced, it will be posted here on Insider Gaming.
